name: Cr 399 (Coathanger)
notes: Binocular asterism in Vulpecula, resembles a coat hanger

name: Kemble's Cascade
notes: Line of stars in Camelopardalis; binocular field

name: Barnard 59
notes: Dense dark nebula near Pipe Nebula

name: Barnard 65-7
notes: Complex of dark nebulae in Pipe region

name: Barnard 78
notes: Part of Pipe Nebula complex, visible as a dark lane

name: Mizar and Alcor
notes: Naked-eye double in Ursa Major; binocular showpiece

name: IC 1396 (Elephant's Trunk)
notes: Large emission nebula in Cepheus with dark lanes

name: M17 (Swan/Omega Nebula)
notes: Shows swan/omega shape; OIII enhances contrast.

name: M8
notes: Bright H II region with embedded cluster; UHC/OIII helpful.

name: M16
notes: Open cluster + nebulosity; 'Pillars' need dark skies.

name: NGC 2070 (Tarantula Nebula)
notes: In LMC; huge H II region; best from southern sites.

name: M20 (Trifid Nebula)
notes: Distinct dark lanes; use moderate magnification.

name: Small Magellanic Cloud
notes: Dwarf galaxy; look for 47 Tuc nearby.

name: Abell 1656 (Coma Cluster)
notes: Coma galaxy cluster, hundreds of galaxies

name: Fornax Cluster
notes: Rich cluster of galaxies in Fornax

name: Markarian's Chain
notes: Chain of galaxies in Virgo Cluster

name: NGC 5139 (Omega Centauri)
notes: Very low from 45°N (spring). Crowded core; best with low power.

name: 47 Tucanae (NGC 104)
notes: Southern showpiece near SMC; not visible from 45°N.

name: M24 (Small Sag. Star Cloud)
notes: Rich star field; sweep with wide-field eyepiece.

name: Epsilon Lyrae (Double Double)
notes: Near Vega; requires small telescope to split

name: Melotte 20 (Alpha Persei Cluster)
notes: Huge naked-eye cluster around α Persei

name: Melotte 111 (Coma Berenices Cluster)
notes: Large nearby open cluster, visible to naked eye

name: NGC 6231
notes: At Scorpius’ tail. Compact, bright; low from 45°N.

name: M7
notes: Large, rich cluster in Scorpius; superb in binoculars.

name: IC 4665
notes: Large, sparse cluster in Ophiuchus, visible in binoculars

name: M6
notes: Striking 'butterfly' shape; best in wide-field views.

name: Stock 2
notes: Loose cluster near Double Cluster, aka 'Muscle Man'

name: M67
notes: King Cobra or Golden Eye Cluster NGC 2682

name: King 10
notes: Open cluster in Cassiopeia, faint but interesting

name: Centaurus A (NGC 5128)
notes: Low from 45°N (spring). Dark lane bisects bright core.

name: IC 418 (Spirograph Nebula)
notes: Compact PN in Lepus, bright with filters

name: M94
notes: Crocodile Eye or Cat's Eye Galaxy NGC 4736

name: M77
notes: Cetus A or Squid Galaxy NGC 1068
